resources.string: If you have any development, modifications, or questions, please write them down. (Up to 200 characters)
Feedback is sent via the G-mail app.
Change the title of a timetable
Start time cannot be greater than end time.
Start time cannot be the same as end time.
The minimum time for each schedule is 30 minutes.
There is other schedule at that time.
Please select the last day of the week.
The timetable title has been changed.
The timetable has been saved to the gallery.
Are you sure you want to delete the schedule?
Change the time of a timetable
Start time cannot be less than 6.
Start time cannot be greater than 24.
End time cannot be less than 6.
End time cannot be greater than 24.
The schedule exists at that time.
The schedule exists on that day of the week.
Please enter the last day of week between Fri, Sat, and Sun.

Thank you for downloading our app.

 I'd like to give you a basic set of
 instructions for better use.
(You can always see Guide again\n via the \"Show Guide\" in the menu)
Before adding a schedule, you should add \na timetable first. Press the button below \nto go to the Add Timetable screen.
Here is the Add Timetable screen.\n Please set the title and time of the timetable\n as appropriate and select Last day of week.
Examples are prepared to\n help you understand.

You have now laid the foundation.

 Use the Add Schedule button at the bottom
 right to add a schedule or the menu at the
 top right to use the add-on function.
Thank you for using the Guide.
(Guide may be added or changed\n depending on future updates)
Cannot calculate because the value of the Cycle is zero.
The value of the (current)Cycle cannot be greater than the (month)Cycle value.
Unable to calculate due to exceeding the Cycle.\n(Please pay manually and use it.)
Do you want to use the automatic calculation?
The current number of classes this month
The total number of classes this month
The current number of classes cannot be greater than the total number of classes.
Total number of classes cannot be less than the current number of classes.
The automatic calculation is not available without notification.
The automatic calculation is not available without notification. Do you want to turn off automatic calculation?

Lesson Mode, which is the biggest advantage
 of this app, provides special services for
 teachers to manage classes more conveniently.

Lesson Mode can be enabled on the "Add
 Schedule" and "Schedule Information" screens
 as shown in the following photos.

When you enable Lesson Mode, the "Schedule 
Information" screen will be added with the
 screen shown below. After that, you just
 need to enter the information into the item

*Caution: The "Cycle" function can be
 complicated and difficult, so be sure to
 look at the following examples and guides!

The following is a example of Lesson Mode
 to help you understand. To give you a quick
 explanation of the "Cycle" here, in the 
example below, "Cycle: 0/4" to 4 indicates 
how many times a month you are teaching, 
and 0 indicates the number of times you 
have taught so far today.

The Cycle feature helps you manage 
the number and cost of lessons easily. 

The (calculation)Cycle method includes 
(automatic/manual), which can be adjusted 
through the notification function. 

Please turn on the switch if you want 
automatic calculation under the assumption 
that you will use the calculation function. 
If you want manual calculation, turn
 off the switch.

For those who want to use the calculation 
function manually (or if they are forced 
to make a calculation manually while using 
automatic calculation), set the "Cycle" and 
press the "Calculation Button" below.

The basic setup of automatic calculation 
does not differ from manual calculation. 

However, the automatic calculation works 
based on the notification, so you have to 
turn on the notification to work. When the 
automatic calculation function is activated, 
the notification will be received as shown 
in the picture below. If you press "Closed" at 
this time, the (current)Cycle will not be 
increased. If you press "Proceed", (current)
Cycle will increase by one time, and when
 (current)Cycle is equal to (Month)Cycle, 
the calculation message will be printed.

Depending on the Android version, you may
 not be able to see the "Closed" and "Proceed"
 buttons as follows, but press the button
 below to display them!
